Fields.DialogueText: Capitaine, explain to me again why our crew is made up of children?
They're not children, don't exaggerate.
I refer to their competence, not their age.

Fields.MenuText: Just give them a chance.
I'll admit they're still a bit fresh.
I don't want you speaking to them like that.

Fields.DialogueText: They had a chance when I let them on board.
Fresh? Interesting choice of word.
Of course not, Capitaine. I wouldn't dare harm their precious feelings. Why, their little hearts would simply...
Look Suffren, from time to time we need to take on new crew members. Everyone has to start somewhere.
Perhaps a paper ship, in a puddle. Wouldn't that be fun for them? I've heard fun is...
*ALARM*
That's enough. Let's get to work.
D'accord. Ready for battle, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
Suffren, we have our orders from Command. A large detachment of ships has gone missing.
What was their mission?
They were dispatched to investigate several missing ships in the area.
Hmph... Then logically we should repeat the same course of action and expect different results?
They didn't have a Belle with them before. You're right, though. That doesn't make much of a difference.
You are trying to get a rise out of me by attacking my pride.
Is it working?
Keep trying.

Fields.MenuText: Fine, humor-free zone.
Do you ever laugh?
I want contingency plans by tomorrow, relating to all Morgana abductions we know about.

Fields.DialogueText: I prefer to keep the clowns out of battle conversations.
Oui, often, when I hear something funny.
Oui, Capitaine.
This is an important mission. If those sailors are out there, we are going to find them.
*ALARM*
Morganas, approaching from the south.
Bring us around.
Oui.
@BATTLE
Suffren, if that's not coffee, you don't need to hand it to me right now. Whatever it is, I'll sign it later.
Suffren? You look like you have something else to say...
Capitaine, you wouldn't mind if I made some changes to the crews work schedule?

Fields.MenuText: No, just show me a plan to approve.
Was that a question?
Are you telling me?

Fields.DialogueText: Oui, but I would like to start immediately.
I... suppose so.
Non, Capitaine, just assuming you would make the correct decision.
Then what are you planning on changing?
Increased training, scenario runs, cross profession training.
Sounds good to me.
And another thing, Capitaine, I see that most of the women on this ship are serving in noncombat roles. This is unacceptable. I am not a transport vessel.
Every member of the crew must learn a combat role, to replace casualties and cowards.
Knowing how to defend themselves would ultimately be for their own well-being. I will have senior staff host briefings.
I would like to train them myself.
As long as it doesn't interfere with your duties.
*ALARM*
There is very little that can interfere with my duties. Are you prepared to engage, Capitaine?
Yes, set course for the Morgana forces.
@BATTLE
Suffren, I have been receiving some complaints from the crew.
This surprises you, Capitaine?
Shouldn't it?
Not if you have seen them. You could pierce their skin with butter.
What concerns me further is that I did not hear of these complaints from you.
I report legitimate concerns to you, Capitaine.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds good to me.
Just let me see the complaints. I'm sure it will be fine.
Give them some time to adjust. You've flipped their schedules upside down.

Fields.DialogueText: As it does to me.
Bien sûr, Capitaine. I am used to being second-guessed.
Oui, there may be dire consequences to denying them naptime.
Suffren, I appreciate your vigor, but let's remember the enemy is out there. I don't want the crew more stressed than they already are.
That is exactly what I prepare them for, Capitaine.
*ALARM*
Lower your standard for legitimate concerns. Let's go.
D'accord.
@BATTLE
Capitaine!? Have you gone behind my back to alter my schedule?
I'm the captain, I don't need to go behind anyone's back, and it is my schedule ultimately.
With all due respect, they are not ready. They are returning to my schedule at the start of the next shift.
No, they aren't.
If you are incapable of preparing...
Careful, Suffren...
Do you think those lost ships also had capitaines who cared more for their crew's feelings than their military effectiveness!?
STAND DOWN!
... Capitaine.
Let me clear up confusion that's been festering. I welcome criticism of my procedures. In fact, if you didn't question my decisions, I would dismiss you for not performing your duties.
However, you will not be blatantly insubordinate. Are we clear?
Absolutely, Capitaine.

Fields.MenuText: My commission is based off my merit, not your opinion.
You don't think I'm qualified? Get over it!
I'm in charge. I'm the captain.

Fields.DialogueText: That is true.
Je comprends.
Oui, Capitaine, you have made that clear.
*ALARM*
Morganas approaching.
Capitaine, permission to speak plainly?
Quickly.
I despise taking orders from spineless leaders who do not stand for what they believe. It looks like I was wrong about you. Heavy Cruiser Suffren, reporting for duty, Capitaine.
Good. You know, maybe these Morganas are here just to talk?
@BATTLE
Moonlight Sonata?
Quoi?
What you're tapping there, with your fingers. It's Beethoven, right?
It is. Are you a musician, Capitaine?

Fields.MenuText: I'm a musician who happens to be a captain on the side.
I wouldn't say musician, but yes, I know some things about music.
Not at all - I've just heard that song a lot.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! That surprises me.
Then we have something we can talk about, other than battle and Morganas.
It is a popular one.
Do you play the piano?
I do, although I rarely get the chance to.
Why not?
*ALARM*
The Capitaine asks and the world answers.
Right, change course.
Capitaine, moving to intercept the Morgana forces.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, here are some more complaints that have been filed against me.
Do we have enough paper on the ship to keep this up?
Non, Capitaine. You will be receiving significantly fewer complaints in a month or so.
I will, but not because we are out of paper. Suffren, look at all of these.
These women are not used to being hard, Capitaine. They foster a delusion they will be taken care of...
There are complaints from the men as well.
Strange, isn't it? They must be British. Where did they get the idea they were meant to be pampered?

Fields.MenuText: Suffren, you need to work with our people more effectively.
Maybe we could use some training on sensitivity.
And more glaring evidence that you are the one causing problems. I will fix that with training.

Fields.DialogueText: I think I am experiencing seasickness for the first time.
Sensitivity?! Capitaine, I am a heavy cruiser. I find this wholly inappropriate.
Surely you don't mean-- that... ? Capitaine, this is unnecessary.
If that's a complaint, you are welcome to put it in writing and submit it to me.
... Touché.
*ALARM*
Morganas incoming. Prepare to engage them.
But Capitaine, maybe there is an alternative. Couldn't they be more self-conscious about how they behave and lash out? Maybe they spilled their...
Cut it out. Let's go.
Oui, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, how many more sensitivity training sessions do we have left?
I'm hoping this will be the last one.
In that case, s'il vous plaît, continuez.

Fields.MenuText: You think this is a waste of time still?
Let's at least pretend we are motivated here.
I'm glad you're excited.

Fields.DialogueText: I did, but I have come around, Capitaine.
I was joking - please, go on.
I may not be excited, but don't misunderstand. I do see the value.
All right, I am going to play the role of an anonymous crewmember.
Oh, be Anderson! That little crème puff, I've got some great...
An anonymous crewmember and remember, we are working off the assumption every member of the crew is striving to do their best.
Give me a moment... mmmm... ready.
"Ma'am, I am exhausted. I hate to ask, but may I be relieved?"
"Crewmember, why are you exhausted?"
"I haven't been able to sleep recently."
"Find someone to cover your shift and then report to medical."
"At once, ma'am." Great, Suffren. Now...
"And crewmember, I will be following up with medical. You are expected to be rested and capable for duty. Correct this issue as quickly as possible."
That's... yes, very good. I think we're done.
Assertive yet empathetic, non?
*ALARM*
Ready?
Setting course, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, I'm curious... what is your leadership philosophy?
Philosophy?
Style, ethos, how you do it.
You're putting me on the spot.
Then if you had to pick the most important quality of a leader, what would it be?

Fields.MenuText: Confidence.
Flexibility.
Empathy.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmmm, a while ago I would have agreed with you.
That's important, to be sure.
When we first met, I would have scoffed at that.
What is your leadership philosophy?
It is evolving.
That's what I would have said, continuing to learn and...
Non! I said it first! Get your own philosophy.
*ALARM*
Ha, fine. Morgana forces, just north of our position.
On it, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, I am picking up a distress call.
Is it one of our missing ships?
Oui, but I'm having difficulty getting an accurate position.

Fields.MenuText: What are they saying?
Why?
Keep at it. I want that location.

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing. It's a transponder.
I'm not sure...
Oui, Capitaine.
If they're transmitting, they must be afloat somewhere.
Oui. The signal wasn't designed for underwater communications.
*ALARM*
Morgana forces, approaching fast.
Can you outrace her to the source of the signal?
It's nice to meet you, Capitaine, I'm Suffren. Have you met one of us Belles before? We...
Okay, okay, I get it. Let's go.
Oui!
*time passes*
Capitaine, in visual range of the ship. I'm getting a message.
Let me hear it.
I... uhmmm... haha... is that...?
We're here to help, but I'm having trouble understanding you. Please respond with your current situation.
You? The situation... situation... what?
Capitaine, Morganas aren't too far behind us.
Send a boarding party to the distressed ship. We'll keep our unwanted visitors at a safe distance.
Oui!
@BATTLE
The last dregs are retreating, Capitaine.
Thank goodness. We need to check in with the boarding party and...
*BOOM*
Hell! Where's our boarding party?
They were at the hull of the ship when it exploded.
Search and rescue, now!
Already on it!
Capitaine, the ship-
Tragic. Do we know what caused the explosion yet?
There isn't enough information, Capitaine, but the most likely cause was an internal explosion.
Accidental?
Non.

Fields.MenuText: The crew caused the explosion?
What do you mean?
Sabotage?

Fields.DialogueText: Oui, and it was meant to destroy the boarding party.
They detonated their own munitions purposefully, Capitaine.
Possibly, but it was a large explosion.
This... we need answers.
Medical is reporting that the last survivor... is no longer a survivor. All have died.
*ALARM*
Suffren.
Je comprends.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, I am picking up the distress signal from the second missing ship.
Do you have a location?
Not yet.
When you do, set a course.
What do you intend to do?

Fields.MenuText: I don't know yet.
We have to help them.
Protect our crew first.

Fields.DialogueText: Je comprends.
And if they have the same intentions as the first ship we encountered?
Even if we need to destroy the ship - instead of rescue it?
We're going to have to play this by ear.
Bien sûr. Hopefully, I can confirm some suspicions.
*ALARM*
It looks like we have some clean up to do first.
Setting course to engage our enemies, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, in visual range and contact of the second missing ship.
Put me through.
They can hear you.

Fields.MenuText: Crew, we are here on a rescue mission, please respond.
We are the rescue fleet. Respond.
Stand down and stop your engines.

Fields.DialogueText: You... you sound like I sound... maybe?
Fleet? Feet? You... feet rescuer?
Uhmmm... standing... no, standing up, right?
They sound confused, like the other crew.
Capitaine, they have changed course and are heading towards us.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Can you place a shot to disable the ship's rudder? I don't want them getting away.
Like shooting a fly on a horse - but I think I can.
We don't have a choice. Do it, then turn to the Morganas.
Oui, Capitaine!
@BATTLE
The ship... it's gone. Just like the first ship.
Oui. It appears that, when they found themselves unable to maneuver, they detonated.
Survivors?
Non.
Capitaine, I may have a theory as to what is happening with the missing ships.
Tell me.
Morganas can have a strong influence on human minds.
Mind control?
That's one word for it. Think of it as a potent drug that clouds and twists one's intentions - perhaps indirectly.
How do we fight that?
I don't know if we can.

Fields.MenuText: Contact Command and brief them on our situation.
I'll contact Command, see what they know.
There's really no way of combatting their ability?

Fields.DialogueText: Right away, Capitaine.
Oui, Capitaine.
Short of escape, not that I know of.
Well, maybe we can find someone else who has some ideas.
*ALARM*
Maneuvering to face the Morganas, Capitaine.
Do it.
@BATTLE
Suffren, do you have any particular thoughts on which Morgana might be responsible for this?
Oui.
Which one?
Judging from the behavior of the missing crewmembers, I would guess it was Confusion.

Fields.MenuText: Well, that makes sense.
What names these Morganas have...
How dangerous is she?

Fields.DialogueText: It is a chaotic yet specific form of influence.
There is little subtlety amongst the Morgana numbers.
Extremely.
How do we avoid falling into the same situation as the missing ships?
We resist, Capitaine.
*ALARM*
That's a little vague, Suffren.
It's the best advice I can give. Should I engage the Morganas?
Yes, set a course.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, we've received word from Command.
Do they know how to counteract Confusion's influence?
In a way. The missing ships are to be treated as defectors. Destroy on sight.

Fields.MenuText: That can't be right.
I need to speak with someone higher up. Shooting the missing ships should only be a last resort.
Reply with our refusal to accept that.

Fields.DialogueText: It is verbatim.
I'll set up the communiqué.
D'accord - but I doubt it will do any good.
That can't be the only option.
*ALARM*
Morganas, incoming.
Suffren?
Let's go.
@BATTLE
I can't believe Command would be so obtuse. "Destroy the ships on sight?!"
They are labeled as defectors, Capitaine.
Which is ridiculous.
*ALARM*
Is it?
Yes! Intercept the Morganas.
Oui!
@BATTLE
Capitaine, the crews of the missing ships did succumb to Confusion's power. In a way, they did defect.

Fields.MenuText: They had no choice.
They were influenced. They didn't pledge allegiance.
What else could they have done?

Fields.DialogueText: They did. They weren't strong enough to make it.
Is there much of a difference? If they had fought, they wouldn't be here.
Been stronger.
And what if we were forced to contend with Confusion? What if our crew succumbed to her influence? What then?
I would do what I need to do to protect myself and those who are strong enough to resist.
That's harsh, Suffren.
That's surviving, Capitaine.
Capitaine, I am picking up the last missing ship's distress signal.
Location?
Working on it.

Fields.MenuText: Has Command responded?
Let me know when you have the location, but do not change course.
How likely is it that they are in the same condition?

Fields.DialogueText: Non.
Oui, Capitaine.
Almost certain.
*ALARM*
Morganas.
They are on an intercept course.
Hold the signal and punch through.
Ready.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, I have the location of the missing ship.
Good. All engines stop. Keep us here until we have a plan.
They appear to be moving towards us.

Fields.MenuText: How do they know where we are?
Match their speed, keep our distance.
Are you sure?

Fields.DialogueText: Capitaine, it's possible the other Morganas in the area are communicating with them.
Oui.
Non, but it looks like they are.
We're not ready to engage them yet.
Capitaine, it's my duty to remind you of your orders from Command.
Thank you. They aren't in sight, and we are in no violation.
Oui... technically.
*ALARM*
Here, I have no problem engaging. Prepare to attack.
Oui!
@BATTLE
Capitaine!
They're gaining on us... How is that possible?
I may have an idea.

Fields.MenuText: What is it?
Well, go on.
We're not destroying the ship unless we have to.

Fields.DialogueText: I may be able to help the crew... in a similar way to how Confusion is corrupting them.
Confusion is poisoning their mind. Maybe I can help alleviate the poison.
Oui - and I may be able to help them regain their minds.
You mean you can go into their heads? Like Confusion?
Not *into* their heads... but more like an enveloping influence. An interference to break Confusion's hold.
Would you be in any danger?
Well, if Confusion caught on to what I was doing, she might target me instead.
Then it's your call.
I want... I need to try, Capitaine.
*ALARM*
Then prepare in any way that you need.
The first step is to get rid of these Morganas.
Agreed.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, I'm as ready as I'll ever be.
What do I need to do?
When I attempt to influence the crew on that ship, all of my concentration will be trained there.
So the crew and myself will be on our own.
Oui. Be on high alert.

Fields.MenuText: You have nothing to worry about.
Understood.
I hope we can handle it.

Fields.DialogueText: I know that, Capitaine.
I have complete faith in you, Capitaine.
I believe in your ability, truly.
I'll inform the crew. I want to run some drills to prepare us.
Oui, Capitaine.
And Suffren, thank you. You don't have to do this.
*ALARM*
Let's not make it a big deal, Capitaine. Intercept?
That's what we do with Morganas.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, in visual range and communication with the last missing ship. They can hear you.
We are the rescue fleet. Please respond.
Uhmmm... how do I... am I responding?
Suffren, whenever you're ready.
I'm starting now.
*ALARM*
Of all the horrible timing.

Fields.MenuText: Suffren, stay focused, and we'll handle this.
Don't worry about that.
Morganas? We have her.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't be crazy, Capitaine. You need my help.
I'd be a fool not to worry.
Not without me, you don't.
Crew, we need to take care of this Morgana pack quickly! Suffren, as soon as the battle's over, I want all of your attention back on that lost ship!
Oui!
@BATTLE
Come in, come in! Can anyone hear me?
Captain?  I'm... the munitions were set to explode. I don't... Why? I stopped it.
... Suffren?
... Looks as if my plan worked. But we don't have much time - we need to send a rescue party, now!
You heard her! Get that crew off that ship!
It looks like every crew member has been accounted for.
Oui, Capitaine. They are in medical now, but there doesn't seem to be any serious injuries.
Where are you going?
Suffren? Who was that?
Why do you go? You don't want to stay? Why?
Capitaine, you need to focus.
... Huh?
Capitaine, focus on getting out of here and nothing else!
why? wHy? WhY!? WHY!?
Crew, pay attention! You know who to listen to around here, me! You only listen to me right now, get us out of here!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Are we safe?
That was... horrible.
What happened?

Fields.DialogueText: For now. We are far enough away from Confusion.
You nearly had a Morgana in your brain, Capitaine.
Confusion wasn't pleased by our disrupting her fun, clearly.
Then let's get out of here.
Oui.
Right. Okay. Lieutenant, I need you to find out how bad the damage is.
Suffren...
The survivors are going to be sent home. They did want to thank you in person, Suffren.
I know.
Are you okay?
I was wrong, Capitaine, about them being weak. I could feel what they were dealing with, the force of Confusion's influence. Fighting her off was no small task.
It's good knowledge to have, moving forward.
I'm... ashamed of the way I spoke of the crews of those other ships. Thinking I was strong and they were weak. I...

Fields.MenuText: You didn't know of any other alternatives then. You did what you had to save lives.
We've all made decisions like that. I know it's not easy.
We made those decisions together. You aren't responsible for them all by yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: Saving lives is no excuse for needlessly taking them. I'll be all right.
And it never will be.
And we must live with the consequences...
*ALARM*
I'm here for you.
Oui, I know that. Preparing to engage the Morgana.
Get us into range and start blasting, Suffren.
@BATTLE
Have we gotten word on our next mission, Capitaine?
No, not yet.
Then what is this construction crew doing on the ship? I thought they were installing equipment for a mission.
You're going to think I'm crazy...
What are they putting in?
... and they even said it'd be a waste of space on a ship.
I'm starting to think you're annoying, Capitaine.
I'm having a piano installed in the common room.
... I don't know what to say. Merci.

Fields.MenuText: On the condition that you teach me a few songs I don't know.
On the condition that I can listen to you play sometimes.

Fields.DialogueText: But I'd like to attach a condition...
I'd agree to almost anything, Capitaine.
